intro: Geissorhiza juncea, commonly known as the yellow rain lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has strap-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are often clustered in a loose inflorescence. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Geissorhiza juncea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
